title: Install next-themes and set up dark mode foundation
description:
## Files
- package.json (modify)
- src/app/globals.css (modify)
- src/components/ThemeProvider.tsx (create)
- src/components/ThemeToggle.tsx (create)
- src/app/layout.tsx (modify)

## What to do

### 1. Install next-themes
Run `npm install next-themes` to add the dependency.

### 2. Update globals.css
Add the Tailwind v4 dark variant after the `@import "tailwindcss"` line:
```css
@custom-variant dark (&:where(.dark, .dark *));
```

Add dark mode scrollbar styles after the existing light scrollbar styles:
```css
.dark .overflow-y-auto {
  scrollbar-color: #3f3f46 transparent;
}
.dark .overflow-y-auto::-webkit-scrollbar-thumb {
  background-color: #3f3f46;
}
```

### 3. Create ThemeProvider.tsx
Create `src/components/ThemeProvider.tsx` â€” a client component wrapping `next-themes`:
```tsx
"use client"
import { ThemeProvider as NextThemesProvider } from "next-themes"
export function ThemeProvider({ children }: { children: React.ReactNode }) {
  return (
    <NextThemesProvider attribute="class" defaultTheme="light" enableSystem={false}>
      {children}
    </NextThemesProvider>
  )
}
```
- `attribute="class"` toggles `.dark` on `<html>`
- `defaultTheme="light"` â€” light by default
- `enableSystem={false}` â€” do not follow OS preference

### 4. Create ThemeToggle.tsx
Create `src/components/ThemeToggle.tsx` â€” a client component with sun/moon icons:
- Uses `useTheme()` from `next-themes`
- Has a `mounted` state guard (renders a `<div className="w-9 h-9" />` placeholder until mounted to avoid hydration mismatch)
- When dark: shows sun icon (â˜€ï¸ as SVG). When light: shows moon icon (ğŸŒ™ as SVG).
- onClick toggles between "light" and "dark"
- Button classes: `p-2 text-zinc-500 hover:text-zinc-900 dark:text-zinc-400 dark:hover:text-zinc-100 rounded-lg hover:bg-zinc-100 dark:hover:bg-zinc-800 transition-colors cursor-pointer`
- Has `aria-label` for accessibility
- Use inline SVG icons (no external icon library):
  - Sun: `<svg className="w-5 h-5" fill="none" viewBox="0 0 24 24" strokeWidth={1.5} stroke="currentColor"><path strokeLinecap="round" strokeLinejoin="round" d="M12 3v2.25m6.364.386l-1.591 1.591M21 12h-2.25m-.386 6.364l-1.591-1.591M12 18.75V21m-4.773-4.227l-1.591 1.591M5.25 12H3m4.227-4.773L5.636 5.636M15.75 12a3.75 3.75 0 11-7.5 0 3.75 3.75 0 017.5 0z" /></svg>`
  - Moon: `<svg className="w-5 h-5" fill="none" viewBox="0 0 24 24" strokeWidth={1.5} stroke="currentColor"><path strokeLinecap="round" strokeLinejoin="round" d="M21.752 15.002A9.718 9.718 0 0118 15.75c-5.385 0-9.75-4.365-9.75-9.75 0-1.33.266-2.597.748-3.752A9.753 9.753 0 003 11.25C3 16.635 7.365 21 12.75 21a9.753 9.753 0 009.002-5.998z" /></svg>`

### 5. Update layout.tsx
- Add `suppressHydrationWarning` to the `<html>` tag
- Import `ThemeProvider` from `@/components/ThemeProvider`
- Wrap the content inside `<body>` with `<ThemeProvider>` (outside WagmiProvider is fine, or inside â€” just wrap the visual tree)
- Add `dark:bg-zinc-950 dark:text-zinc-100` to the `<body>` className
- Add `dark:text-zinc-600` to the footer span (currently `text-zinc-300`)

## Dont
- Do NOT add ThemeToggle to Header â€” that is a separate task
- Do NOT add dark: classes to any other components besides layout.tsx
- Do NOT use a tailwind.config.js/ts file â€” Tailwind v4 uses CSS-first config
- Do NOT set enableSystem={true} â€” we want explicit toggle only
- Do NOT use any icon library like lucide-react or heroicons â€” use inline SVGs
acceptance_criteria:
1. `npm ls next-themes` shows next-themes installed
2. ThemeProvider.tsx exists at src/components/ThemeProvider.tsx and exports a ThemeProvider component
3. ThemeToggle.tsx exists at src/components/ThemeToggle.tsx and exports a ThemeToggle component
4. globals.css contains `@custom-variant dark` directive
5. globals.css contains dark scrollbar styles for `.dark .overflow-y-auto`
6. layout.tsx has `suppressHydrationWarning` on the `<html>` tag
7. layout.tsx imports and renders `<ThemeProvider>` wrapping the app content
8. Body tag has both `bg-white` and `dark:bg-zinc-950` classes
9. `npm run build` succeeds with no errors
10. Toggling the theme in the browser (via next-themes) switches the page background between white and dark

### page.tsx dark mode classes

**Hero section:**

- p: `text-zinc-500` â†’ add `dark:text-zinc-400`

**Action buttons:**
- "Link Identity": `bg-emerald-600 text-white hover:bg-emerald-700` â€” no dark changes needed (green on dark bg looks fine)
- "Verify": `bg-white text-zinc-700 border-zinc-200 hover:bg-zinc-50 hover:border-zinc-300` â†’ add `dark:bg-zinc-900 dark:text-zinc-300 dark:border-zinc-700 dark:hover:bg-zinc-800 dark:hover:border-zinc-600`

**How it works & Features section headers:**
- `text-zinc-400` â†’ add `dark:text-zinc-500`

**Step component:**
- Step circle: `bg-emerald-100 text-emerald-700` â†’ add `dark:bg-emerald-900/30 dark:text-emerald-400`
- Step title: `text-zinc-800` â†’ add `dark:text-zinc-200`
- Step description: `text-zinc-500` â†’ add `dark:text-zinc-400`

**Feature component:**
- Feature text: `text-zinc-700` â†’ add `dark:text-zinc-300`
- Feature desc: `text-zinc-400` â†’ add `dark:text-zinc-500`
- Checkmark: `text-emerald-500` â€” fine in dark mode, no change

### GeometricBackground.tsx dark mode

The geometric background uses hardcoded emerald colors in SVGs (`rgb(52, 211, 153)`, `#34d399`). These are semi-transparent and work on both light and dark backgrounds. However:

- The emerald lines/shapes use opacity values like `opacity="0.4"` and `opacity="0.5"` which might be too bright on dark backgrounds. Reduce to `opacity="0.25"` and `opacity="0.3"` for dark mode by using the `useTheme()` hook from `next-themes`.
- OR simply keep as-is since they are decorative with low opacity. The simplest approach: **just keep existing colors** â€” emerald at 40-50% opacity works on both white and near-black backgrounds.

The component uses CSS-in-JS (`<style jsx>`) for keyframe animations â€” no changes needed there.
